author: Nistula Hebbar
text:
A worried BJP president Amit Shah has summoned the party’s core group members from the Punjab unit for a meeting on Saturday, with the party’s prospects looking bleak in Punjab in the Assembly polls in 2017, and noted cricketer and former MP Navjyot Singh Sidhu rebuffing attempts by the party to rope him for the campaign.

“There are two basic things that the party president wants to discuss, one is about electing a new president for the State unit and the other is how to recover the party’s prospects which are looking rather bleak,” said a senior office-bearer in the party.

Sources also disclosed that the party had approached former MP Navjyot Singh Sidhu to be one of the main faces of the party’s campaign in the State, not once but twice and had been strongly rebuffed by the former cricketer.

“He made it clear that as long as the BJP was in alliance with the Shiromani Akali Dal, with whom he has serious differences, he would not be available for any campaigning,” said the source.

Party leaders fear that he might be in touch with the Aam Aadmi Party and might even switch over, finding that his issues were not being addressed in the BJP.

The alarm bells for the BJP started ringing when the cricketer’s wife, also called Navjyot Sidhu, made a public statement suggesting that BJP voters would be better off if they cast votes for AAP rather than the BJP if it continued its alliance with the Shiromani Akali Dal.
title: Sidhu rebuffs BJP efforts to rope him in for campaign
